text.p: Estiko group said on Tuesday that it was expanding its production with the formation of a new subsidary called Estiko-Raamex.
Estiko said in a statement that the new subsidiary will produce food packaging materials.
Estiko-Raamex will invest 15 million kroons into the production facility with nine million kroons going into the building and six million kroons into equipment.
Estiko-Raamex is expected to bring in 10 million kroons in sales and 800,000 kroons in profit in 1997.
Raamex's 400,000 kroon share capital is owned by AS Estiko-Plastar with 70 percent, Veljo Ipits 15 percent and Vambola Kolbakov 15 percent.
Estiko-Plastar is part of the Estiko Group and its sales turnover forecast for 1997 is 87.9 million kroons and sales forecast for 1998 growing to 160 million kroons.
Estiko-Plastar will also invest seven million kroons into a production plant in Tartu.
